column4: ~~~Question~~~  I want to add sudo mount /dev/sdb1  to my sessions    so its mounted when I log in -  but it will ask me for root pasword! how do i do it so it doesnt ask?
!init
make an entry in fstab and use the 'users,noauto' options
doesnt work
can you elaborate
doesnt mount at boot whenn i do that
you still have to run a mount command from your login scripts. It won't need a password, though.
you need a file with two lines: first    #!/bin/bash    second     mount /your/mountpoint
thats it? :D where do I save it? then chmod +x uh?
save this to /home/mimi/bin  and run chmod +x on it
then call it from System-Preferences-Session-Startup programs
thank you very much for your help, im going to test it now... baaai! :)
what did you call the mount script, and where did you save it?
~/bin like you said   called it   mount-usb
and when you run '~/bin/mount-usb' in a terminal, what happens?
aaah.... Unprivileged user can not mount NTFS block devices using the external FUSE
im trying to fix the problem with http://ntfs-3g.org/support.html#unprivileged   .... do you know what the second box means?  (the chown root.ntfsuser one)
I wouldn't do that. If you add yourself to the fuse group ('sudo adduser $USER fuse'), that should fix the problem (retry your script afterwards)
thanks *gives it a try*
I mean, log out and log back in, then retry the script
